concept.title: Multiprocessing and Threads
concept.shortdesc: This section describes the integration of the Java SDK into the multithreaded environment of the JVM.

section.title: Multithreaded Access
section.p: All APIs in Couchbase Java SDK are thread safe and can be used across multiple threads without further synchronization. In fact, adding synchronized blocks or RW-Locks slows down the operations unnecessarily.
In practice, this means that instantiated Bucket and Cluster instances can and should be shared across threads.

Because of this fact and resource management related aspects, it is very important to not create Bucket and Cluster instances per thread. This will slow down performance to a large degree and is considered bad practice.

section.title: Safe Sharing & Singletons
